comment: A very nice and smooth every day bourbon not too much bight
Vanilla, banana, cinnamon nose with a touch of citrus.  Sweet on the pallet with medium rye spice finish
It’s fine. For the price it’s a good value.
A bit of a bite for a 90 proof however that is short lived.  Pick up spice/pepper, oak and caramel.
Starts sweet, then vanilla and lots of oak
Absolutely delicious. If you love Larceny, this will top that. Smooth, sweet, flavorful. Great caramel notes. Will be a staple on my bar.

Mash Bill: 70% corn, 20% rye, 10% malt
Peppery rye "kick" typical of higher-rye Bourbon mashbills
Nose: Honey, pie spices, butterscotch
Palate: Oak, ginger, rye spice and toasted cereal notes. Medium body.
Finish: Long, warm, cereal/grain and spice notes
Reported to have a lower barrel entry proof than standard.
Sharp alcoholic finish shows young age.  Middle is very floral, nose is weak.
This is Buffalo Trace but a 4ish year. A bit young and a little ethanol but corn heavy and lots of vanilla. Great but needs a bit more aging.
I get brown sugar and cinnamon while tasting this. Very smooth, some alcohol burn on the back end.
Drinking neat. Smooth and a bit sweet , good flavor on a cold day
